meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>bribe</kanji>, but when you pay a bribe, you are going <vocabulary>to pay</vocabulary> something or <vocabulary>to cover</vocabulary> something, like a meal, or something like that.
readingMnemonic: You need to make a payment, <reading>make a</reading> payment <reading>now</reading> (まかなう) <vocabulary>to cover</vocabulary> the cost of this room.
